common_issues.title: Chrome Extension Causing Stack Overflow Error
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing stack overflow errors when using the Pieces Chrome extension. The extension appears to be repeatedly filling text, as illustrated in the provided image. The issue has been acknowledged and is being investigated by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
related_issues.text:
Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

It fills this text endlessly...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6b5edb10-b7cf-4fa6-a523-aa73af94cbee)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** User reported an issue (details not provided).

**Key points:**

* User thanked for reporting the issue.
* Issue automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* User advised to expect a follow-up within 24 hours.
* Resources provided for further assistance.

**Problems identified:**

* Specific issue details not provided in the conversation excerpt.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Issue triaged and routed to the relevant team member.
* User provided with helpful resources.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User awaiting follow-up from the Pieces team member.

**Additional notes:**

* Conversation excerpt only provides limited information about the specific issue.
* It is recommended to review the full issue conversation and any relevant follow-up comments for a more comprehensive understanding.

recommendations: **Investigate and resolve the Chrome extension stack overflow error:** This issue is causing significant user frustration and should be prioritized for resolution.
**Improve communication on known issues:** Provide clear and timely updates to users regarding the status of the Chrome extension error.
**Gather more detailed information on bug reports:** Encourage users to provide more context and steps to reproduce issues to aid in debugging and resolution.
**Review and update documentation:** Ensure that the documentation for the Chrome extension is up-to-date and addresses the stack overflow error.
**Monitor and analyze ticket trends:** Track the frequency and types of support tickets to identify recurring problems and areas for improvement in the product or support processes.
